name: Commercial Lighting, IECC c. 2015

market_entry_year_source.notes: Year in which standard went into effect

energy_efficiency_source.notes: See table C405.4.2, 'Office'; use Scout Cost Conversion Data on 1000 lm/ft^2 floor to get from original 0.82 W/ft^2 floor -> 59.76 lm/W

source_data.title: Scout Cost Conversion Data
source_data.author: Langevin, J.
source_data.organization: U.S. Department of Energy, Building Technologies Office

installed_cost_source.notes: Assumes linear fluorescent as the dominant commercial lighting type, uses 2010 T8 bulb type costs for 'linear fluorescent' lamp type in EIA NEMS 'rsmlgt.txt' file; converts from $/bulb to $/1000 lm by assuming 33 W/lamp, 0.82 W/ft^2 floor from IECC standard, and 0.049 lm/ft^2 floor from Scout Cost Conversion Data

source_data.title: Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation
Scout Cost Conversion Data
source_data.author: Langevin, J.
source_data.organization: U.S. Department of Energy, Building Technologies Office

product_lifetime_source.notes: Assumes linear fluorescent as the dominant commercial lighting type, use 2010 T8 bulb type lifetime for 'linear fluorescent' lamp type in EIA NEMS 'rsmlgt.txt' file, with 12h/day use

source_data.title: Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation

_description: Commercial lighting that meets the IECC performance standard in 2015
_notes: Includes all building types with IECC lighting intensity near that of 'Office'; assumes linear fluorescent as the dominant commercial lighting type and T8 as the dominant bulb type in estimating cost/lifetime
